str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To cut around, circumcise. From peri and the base of tomoteros; to cut around, i.e. to circumcise.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To cut around, circumcise. From peri and the base of tomoteros; to cut around, i.e. to circumcise.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To boast; I glory (exult) proudly. From some base akin to that of aucheo and euchomai; to vaunt.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 2nd Person Plural
str2: Your, yours. From humeis; yours, i.e. Pertaining to you.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
